result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles R. Hultman, #362037 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation once released. 
May petition for early discharge at 1.5 years.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to probation while on probation. Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment.
Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge - payable to probation while on probation. Failure to pay may result in civil judgment.

Not illegal substances.   
Not to have contact with: Jeffrey Hanvelt.

No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
$2,498.18 to be paid as additional costs to pick up Defendant from Floria.

superMiscConds.notes: May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  

Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

All outstanding financial obligations to be paid through DOC while incarcerated or on supervision.  Failure to pay will be reduced to a civil judgment made payable to the Clerk of Court's Office and subject to tax intercept and other collection efforts.

Defendant Charles R. Hultman in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller.  Defendant Charles R. Hultman in custody.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JP-clerk 2 cases: 15CF183 & 15CF188.  Ct reviews PWQ.  Ct finds made FVIK and bound over to circuit court for further proceedings.  ADA provides court with information.  Motion re: bail filed today.  ADA can go forward and not opposed.  Atty Biller addresses ct.    Ct grants Atty Biller 20 days for PTM.  Ct reduces from cash bail, to SIB of $2500 on each case.  All prior conditions are imposed.
